questions.question: What work can students engage in during OPT?
questions.answer: Students can only engage in employment related to their major field of study on OPT.

employment_criteria.field: Must be in major field of study

limitations.hours: No maximum number of jobs or work hours restricted
limitations.field_restriction: Cannot be related to your minor

field_verification.method: Students should show direct connection of job duties to course curriculum
field_verification.consultation: If unsure, ask academic department for opinion
field_verification.responsibility: Ultimately up to the student to demonstrate this connection

questions.question: What are the location requirements for employment?
questions.answer: Students working on OPT can work in-person, in a hybrid format or remotely from within the US.

work_flexibility.geographic: Can work anywhere in the United States
work_flexibility.employer_count: Can work with multiple employers at one time
work_flexibility.changes: Can change employers as many times as they wish

remote_work.restriction: Not possible to work fully remotely from outside of the US
remote_work.requirement: Must report a US address as the site of employment
remote_work.travel: Temporary travel abroad is allowed, but a physical US address is still required

questions.question: What is considered employment?
questions.answer: Students on OPT are expected to be employed during their approved OPT period.

requirements.field: Position must be related to major field of study

questions.question: Is there a limit on the number of days I can be unemployed?
questions.answer: Unemployment limits vary by OPT type

post_completion.consequence: Exceeding 90 days results in F-1 status violation

questions.question: When do I start accruing unemployment days?
questions.answer: You will start accruing unemployment days on your approved OPT start date if you do not report qualifying employment on the SEVP portal.

important_notes.warning: Students who do not receive their EAD card after their OPT start date could also accrue unemployment days
important_notes.severe_consequence: SEVP can terminate your SEVIS record if you have not reported an employer or have exceeded the maximum days of unemployment

status_violations.title: Violations of OPT and F-1 Student Status

questions.question: What happens if you exceed the unemployment limit?
questions.answer: Students who exceed 90 days of unemployment will be considered in violation of their OPT and F-1 status.
student_responsibilities: Report employment on the SEVP portal
Ensure not exceeding 90 days of unemployment

questions.question: What are your options before you exceed the unemployment limit and violate your visa status?
questions.answer: There are several actions you can take before exceeding 90 days of unemployment
